title: Topic 001 Question 488
body: A company's application uses standard tier secure string parameters from AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. The application is receiving error messages when the company tries to update a parameter. The parameter uses an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer managed key for encryption and decryption.
What are the reasons for the error messages? (Choose two.)
options: The application does not have the kms:Encrypt permission for the customer managed key.
The customer managed key is already being used to encrypt another secure string parameter.
Standard tier secure string parameters cannot use a customer managed key for encryption.
The customer managed key that is specified in the application has its key state set to Disabled.
The customer managed key that is specified in the application is using a key alias instead of a key ID.
